arr.name: dc.description
arr.str: The researcher prepared a questionnaire based on the main and the sub-objectives of the study. It was a Likert Scale questionnaire, divided into two parts. First part was to investigate the problems related to teaching EFL writing and the second part was to find out about different teaching techniques used / adopted by EFL teachers while teaching English writing to the EFL learners. The rating scale was divided from 1-5: 1=Strongly Disagree, 2=Disagree, 3=Neither Agree nor Disagree, 4=Agree, 5=Strongly Agree. The first part contained 17 items, the second part consisted 14 statements (items), and an open statement was also given to mention any specific problems faced by the teachers in teaching English writing skill to the EFL learners. Secondly, to check the validity of the questionnaire, it was sent to the four selected, experienced and qualified experts in the field of research as the jury members (a penal). It was to get their opinion and judgment on all the statements’ clarity, appropriateness and relevance. Finally, on per their advice, opinions, and responses, some modification (related to five items’ clarity and relevance) was done in five items of the questionnaire. The instrument was tested firstly on the SPSS for a Reliability check and the result was: Case Processing Summary Reliability Statistics N % Cronbach's Alpha N of Items Cases Valid 20 100.0 Excludeda 0 .0 .746 31 Total 20 100.0 a. Listwise deletion based on all variables in the procedure.

The instrument was tested firstly on the SPSS for a Reliability check and the result was: Case Processing Summary Reliability Statistics N % Cronbach's Alpha N of Items Cases Valid 20 100.0 Excludeda 0 .0 .746 31 Total 20 100.0 a. Listwise deletion based on all variables in the procedure.

doc.str: IRIS Instrument created by YODL workflow.

The researcher prepared a questionnaire based on the main and the sub-objectives of the study. It was a Likert Scale questionnaire, divided into two parts. First part was to investigate the problems related to teaching EFL writing and the second part was to find out about different teaching techniques used / adopted by EFL teachers while teaching English writing to the EFL learners. The rating scale was divided from 1-5: 1=Strongly Disagree, 2=Disagree, 3=Neither Agree nor Disagree, 4=Agree, 5=Strongly Agree. The first part contained 17 items, the second part consisted 14 statements (items), and an open statement was also given to mention any specific problems faced by the teachers in teaching English writing skill to the EFL learners. Secondly, to check the validity of the questionnaire, it was sent to the four selected, experienced and qualified experts in the field of research as the jury members (a penal). It was to get their opinion and judgment on all the statements’ clarity, appropriateness and relevance. Finally, on per their advice, opinions, and responses, some modification (related to five items’ clarity and relevance) was done in five items of the questionnaire. The instrument was tested firstly on the SPSS for a Reliability check and the result was: Case Processing Summary Reliability Statistics N % Cronbach's Alpha N of Items Cases Valid 20 100.0 Excludeda 0 .0 .746 31 Total 20 100.0 a. Listwise deletion based on all variables in the procedure.
